intro: Eleocharis tenuis, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a species of grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. This plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes, ponds, and along the edges of streams. Eleocharis tenuis is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to moist or aquatic environments. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
